casebody.data:
TRAFALGAR HOUSE CONSTRUCTION, INC., Plaintiff-Appellant, v. UNITED STATES, Defendant-Appellee. No. 2007-5138. United States Court of Appeals, Federal Circuit. April 14, 2008. Carl L. Fletcher, Jr., Daniels Law Firm, P.L.L.C., of Charleston, WV, argued for plaintiff-appellant. Robert E. Chandler, Trial Attorney, Commercial Litigation Branch, Civil Division, United States Department of Justice, of Washington, DC, argued for defendant-appellee. With him on the brief were Jeffrey S. Bucholtz, Acting Assistant Attorney General; Jeanne E. Davidson, Director; and Harold D. Lester, Jr., Assistant Director. Of counsel was Brian S. Smith, Trial Attorney.

Before LINN, Circuit Judge, ARCHER, Senior Circuit Judge, and PROST, Circuit Judge.

Judgment

PER CURIAM.

This CAUSE having been heard and considered, it is

ORDERED and ADJUDGED:

AFFIRMED. See Fed. Cir. R. 36.
